intro: Sarcocephalus subditus, commonly known as the dwarf African root, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its root system is notable for its medicinal properties, often used in traditional African medicine. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in moist, shaded environments.
